text: On tap @ The Gingerman. This one has a blurry golden colored body. A nice big lasting just off-white head, hefty in the lacing department. On the nose it¬ís surprisingly pleasant. Not for a HF beer, but for a larger. Soft hay, a little grain. Hop presence, even some malts. Not a massive aroma but it smells nice. Thin stuff in the taste. We¬íll, both in the taste and in the mouth actually. Watery texture vise and about averages on the carbonation. Thin grainy and quote soapy in the taste. Have to admit it tastes clean though. End with wet flatbread and some sweetness from the malts. 15.06.2017
Tap. Fluffy white head. Chill hazed golden lemon yellow. Citrus hops, slight mint, light crackers in aroma. Flavor leans citrusy, touch sour hay, light bread. Lighter soft body
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. HFD #13 Bardzo porzƒÖdny niemiecki Pils, ze ≈õwietnym aromatem szlachetnych chmieli.
Draft: Poured a clear blonde with white head. Aroma is grain and earthy. Taste is nice grain and lager yeast.

May 12, 2016. On tap at Hill Farmstead day at Warpigs. .
Pale golden with a small white head. Aroma is malty, floral and herbal with crisp grain, some minerals and hints of citrus. Taste is light sweet, smooth bitterness. Light to medium bodied, crisp yet smooth, soft to average carbonation. Finish is slight grassy, herbal and floral bitter, crisp with some mineral notes, light malty sweetness. 
Crisp, clean and amazing drinkability.
From tap. hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, grass, bread and grain.

750 ml growler purchase at the brewery on September 28, 2016. Clear gold, small head. Dry barley and lemongrass aroma, sharp hoppiness. Taste of herbs and lemon cereal, dry green hoppiness, bitter hay finish. Quite a plaisant plis!

Growler shared by jc1762. Thanks Jon! Poured a hazy yellow color with a small white, creamy head. Aroma was not what I expected - I expected a dank, resinous blast, but this was a lot more subtle. Pilsner malts. Grassy notes. Light sweet cereal grain notes. Pretty solid.

Growler into a tulip glass showing well filtered bright yellow with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows sweet malts with tea and biscuits. 

The palate is well carbonated and medium bodied. Bready malts with very subtle sweetness and a typical pilsener bitterness.

Ok this is a pretty decent pilsener but still a pilsener. To get a 98% overall people... You can have a personality beyond hyped breweries you know. 
Anyway, good noble hops here and very well balanced for style. Good malt and crisp finish. Golden pour with ok head and good lacing. Tap at Ginger Man.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 On tap at brewery. Pours straw colored with a foamy white head. Strong floral hop aroma with some grass and pilsner malt. Taste is grassy with hops, malt, bread, and grain. Relatively bitter finish. Medium body. Light carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel.

On tap @ Hill Farmstead. A clear golden beer with white foam. It¬ís got an intensely hoppy aroma. Very, very herbal. Lots of floral notes, some subtle citrus, and grass. Actually has a lot more lemon the more I sniff and sip of it. Really nice bready malts, biscuit sweetness, and maybe a touch of dough. Pretty minimal esters. Solid bitterness to the finish without being overdone. Good beer.

(On tap @ Warpigs HF Day, Copenhagen, May 12 2016) Hazy yellow-gold with a loose white head that fades with a little lace. Aroma of pilsner malt cereals, hay, grass, light florals, touch bready and slightly sweet. Flavour is well-balanced, with a sweet touch to the crackery malt, hay and cut grass, floral, fairly lightly bitter but rather so for style, rather crisp as well. Light to medium body, slightly oily, smooth low carbonation. Pilsner isn¬ít really my style but this is a lovely example, flavours are relatively assertive for the style but the balance is very good.
On tap at Hill farmstead brewing. Pours out a straw color topped with a white head. Nose is light grassy notes some spice and a little malty sweetness. Taste is more of the light grassy and malt.

Draft at anchorage brewing, pale yellow beer, big white head. Aroma is malt, honey, clover. Taste is malt, honey, clover, hint of hops, honey. Not as sweet as it sounds, just very floral, light and clean. Omg.
On tap at The Jeffery. Poured gold with white head. Aroma malty bright grains. Med light carb and med bod. Taste light pale malts beats a Bud Light?
Sample @ Hill Farmstead Tap Takeover, Warpigs. Clear yellow body with a small white head. Light malty, bread, grain, light hoppy. Sweet :-)

Cruchon de 2 l partag√©e lors d¬íune d√©gustation entre amis. Ar√¥me: Odeur de c√©r√©ales avec une l√©g√®re pointe citronn√©e. Apparence: La couleur est blonde l√©g√®rement voil√©e avec une tr√®s faible densit√© de bulle. Pr√©sence d¬íun mince col mousseux et d¬íune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Go√ªt de c√©r√©ales avec une pointe de citron et de fruit√©. Dur√©e moyenne de l¬íarri√®re go√ªt. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture l√©g√®rement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arri√®re go√ªt l√©g√®rement houblonn√©. (Rating #7031)

C√©r√©ales et pain au nez. Houblons herbac√©s. Herbes des champs, fines herbes, persil. De couleur dor√©e, tr√®s claire, limpide. Bonne mousse cr√©meuse qui colle sur le verre. Accents de pain √† l¬íentr√©e de bouche. Croustillante et s√®che en bouche avec une finale herbac√©e tr√®s prenante avec des tons de persil et de fines herbes qui laissent une longue amertume sur la langue. √âquilibre parfait. Une superbe pilsner. Sur la coche. Les tons de c√©r√©ales sont en √©quilibre parfait avec le houblonnage.

Draught @ [ Hill Farmsted Tape Take Over ] - Warpigs Brewpub, Flaesketorvet 24, DK-1711 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Hill Farmstead Mary ].Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, light biscuit malt - sweet malt - bread, moderate hoppy, grass, fruity. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, pale malt, fruity malt, grass. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. Very balanced. [20160512]

Draft @ Warpigs Brewpub, Copenhagen. Pours a slightly hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy grassy finish.

Tap. Cloudy pale yellow with. Foamy, white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of bread, grain, lemon, light spice, and grass. Flavor is yeast, lemon, light spice and pine and must grain. Light bodied, juicy with a dry end.
Draught. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Lacks hay and crisp. Oily palate.

(on tap @ Mikkeller) Poured at fridge temperature into a Mikkeller footed tulip reveals a clear golden body with one finger white head that fades somewhat leaving lace. Aroma is malt-forward with predominant notes of grain and cereal and with the noble hops hard to detect to my crude olfactory organ. In the mouth the hops become more present playing a counter-balancing, bittering role to the malt. The flavour is quite assertive and relatively well-balanced making it a rare bird for the style. At first I mistook the assertiveness for farmhouse but recalibration of the palate with water enabled me to recognise the cereals and noble hop bitterness for what it was. Carbonation is medium, body is light to medium and the finish is lingering and relatively crisp. A good expression of the style but it¬ís not really my kind of style
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Clear dark golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of biscuits, hay, crackers, sweet, light syrupy and light bitter.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Hazy golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of hay and hops with notes of grass and flowers.
Malty flavor of hay and hops with notes of grass.
Hoppy finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar Aarhus. Pours clear pale golden with a small white head. Aromas of pale malt, citrus, pilsnery yeasty, perfume. Tastes of biscuits, pale malts, citrussy, floral, light bitter.

On tap at Mikkeller bar Aarhus. Pours a clear, pale yellow with a medium sized white head. Aroma has pilsner malts, light grassy hops, floral yeasty notes, and seems pretty dry. Taste is pretty dry with a hint of leather, light bitter hoppy and a hint of bready sweetness. Average carbonation and a light, crisp body.

Keg. Light hazy yellow/golden, medium sized white head. Green plants, citrus, dried flowers, hay, grass, light bread. Little sweetness, fine soft carbonation, assertive bitterness. Long dry finish. Good.

fra fad
duft: citrus lime lidt gr√∏n duft
smag: citrus lime lidt krydret kant af gr√∏n

Tap. Hazy golden body with an average off-white head. Aroma of citrus, grass, straw and bread. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and decent bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A very nice Pils. üåüüåüüåüüåü
pour pale without head. light malt aroma, with soft floral notes. taste light bitter, light bodied, fresh. light bitter finish
Tap Hazy yellow colour with small white head.Taste is nice fresh of straw corn and malt also good flavor of citrus and herbs really well balanced type of pilsner.
[5/12/16] Draught at Warpigs in Copenhagen. Hazy pale golden. Grainy, bready, slightly sweetish, with nice bitter grassy hops.
Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of straw, malt, and herbs. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw, herbs, malt, and minerals, leading to a bitter finish.

Keg @ WarPigs. Pours tiny hazy deep yellow / pale golden with a frothy white head that leaves some sticky lacing and trace on the glass while slowly dissipating. Smell is tiny malty and heavy floral with crackers, freshly baked white bread, cereal, fresh corn, hay, honey, minerals and lemon peal. Taste is very tiny sweet, bitter and floral. Mouthfeel is crisp, slightly dry, slightly astringent and light to medium bodied. Finish is bitter with fresh bready malts, floral honey and hay. Refreshing, flavourful and perfectly balanced. Magical beautiful pils!

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Day - Warpigs Brewpub, K√∏benhavn
Pours slightly hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain, floral and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long grassy and floral finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Tap @ Warpigs. Clear yellow with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops. grass, straw and a little grainy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, grass, straw, grainy, little sweet and medium bitter.

Draught at Warpigs at the courtesy of Rune. Low fluffy white and quickly disappearing head. Clear thin looking yellow body. Malt grass flavor with a fair amount of hops bitterness and a lot of malt sweetness. Low carbonation. Long finish.

From tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Unclear yellow color with white to off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, bready, grainy, straw, grassy, floral, citrusy fruity. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Light to medium oily body with soft carbonation.

On tap outside at WarPigs Brewpub during Hill Farmstead Day, kindly shared by KimJohansen. A straw coloured body with a slight haze. Solid lacing from a fair white head. Grassy hops and pale malty aroma. Rounded taste character containing noble hops, grass and bread. Smooth ending with a fruit hoppy twist. Medium bodied. Decent pilsener (Copenhagen 12.05.2016).

Aroma and taste is grassy and floral hoppy, lemon, straw, hay, crisp and light on the palate with a clean crisp finish. Ok.

Draught @ Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, light corn, hay, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, light bitter, hay, grassy, light citrus, lemonpeel. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light bitter finish. 120516

Sample at Warpigs during Hill Farmstead Day 2016. Clear pale golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Hoppy grassy aroma, floral, citrus, bready notes. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, hay, bready, floral notes. Clean and drinkable.
From Tap. Tr√ºbes hell goldgelbes Bier mit einer mittelgro√üen wei√üen Schaumkrone. Geruch mild hopfig, fruchtig, Pfirsich. Geschmack angenehm hopfig, aromatisch fruchtig, lecker.

Draught @ Hill Farmstead Day, Warpigs, Copenhagen. Pours yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of hay, grass, malts and earthy notes, hints of herbal notes. Taste is grainy malty, earthy and heavy with grass, hay and herbal notes. Finish is grassy, grainy and hoppy with some hay and earthiness. Awesome grainy and grassy pils.
Tap at Warpigs, Copenhagen. Colour is slightly cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Some fruits, grain, dryness and malts. Nothing special.
Light golden yellow.. No hrad.. Herbal grassy hay nose... Grassy hay.. Sweet grain finish
Tap @Warpigs. Clear golden, small white head. Grassy hop aroma. Bitter, hoppy flavour, light grain and a little sweetness.
Really nice nose to it! RICH taste with a nice crispy mouthfeel. Nice!

[email¬†protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden clearish. Pils malty nose, hoppy greens, slightly old leafy, herby. Lightish bodied, well bittered. Herby hoppy, bit leafy finish. Okish pils. Balance pretty good, the hopping, or flavour of it, just isnt the best Ive had. Isnt subtle at all, and tastes sorta old. Perfectly nice drinker overall tho.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tap @ Warpigs, tap take over. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light grainy and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 120516
Tap@ warpigs. Golden color, thin white head. Grainy malty, slightly buttery aroma, some hops. Flavor has mild buttery notes, grains, dust, malt. Excellent pils!

Draught. Yellow coloured. Quite clear. Dense off white head. Aroma. Grass, herbs, caramel. Flavour. Herbs, grass, sweetness, spice. Medium to full bodied. Ends herbal bitter.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap. Pours cloudy yellow with a small ehite head. Aroma is grassy, citrusy and light toasted malt. Bitter, grassy and slight herbal. Bitter, dey and slight herbal finish.
Pours fizzy yellow with a low white head. Aromas of citrus, dank cellar, yeast, grass. Taste is earthy and floral with medium carbonation and body.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head 
Aromas malty bready, citrusy, herbs, crisp hard bread 
Taste has notes of bready malts, herbs, crisp hard bread, hay, grassy 
Mouthfeel is crisp, dry, medium carbonation

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2016 On tap at Warpigs. Hazy pale golden with a small white head. Aroma of fresh grain and hay. Fresh, grassy and fruity flavour with clean malts and a nice bitter finish. Would do decently in Franconia

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Tap warpigs. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of bread, citrus, grainy, light straw. Taste is light bitter, light malty. Rather watery. Light bitter finish, good example of a pilsner. But not wordclass imo.

Thanks Doug.
This was poured into a pilsener glass.
The appearance was a semi-hazy medium burnt orange color with a thin white head that quickly dissipated.
The smell started with some sweet grassy hops, light sweet bready malt, subtle lemon.
The taste copied the smell and added in a nice light spice to blend nicely. Aftertaste copies the same flavor. Quick sweet finish.
On the palate, this one was light bodied with a spectacular sessionability about it. Carbonation rides fairly light.
Overall, I¬íd say this was a really nice German pilsener, I¬íd have this again.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 75cl bottle, thanks Peregrinari. Medium white head atop clear apple juice body, nice lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, spicy/grassy, light bread, lemon. Taste is medium sweet, grassy, some spicy, light bread. Light-medium body, some chalky resin.
On tap at Bacchus. Pours a clear amber gold with a large white head. Crisp grain, bread, crackers. Medium bodied, grain, crackers, soft and crisp. Grainy into the finish, crisp and lightly bitter.

Draft at Fools Gold for their Hill Farmstead event, 2/20/16. 

Clear gold. White head and heaving lacing. Bright floral, fruity aroma. Some spice notes. Flavor is similar with a bready malt flavor coming through as well. Drinks very nicely and cleanly. Really nice overall.

The rare Pils that nearly touches 100% for Overall, this beer is a really good German pils that is hoppy and lastingly bitter but unsurprisingly very drinkable. It¬ís quite good, but there are also several other American Pils that might get this same recognition if they were brewed by HF instead of, say, Wiseacre.

Tap at Jeffrey as I run errands in snowy day. Golden pour white head. Nose is doughy and light pepper and citrus. Tastes of bread crust, grains, apricot, peppercorn and floral. Lovely palate and lingering finish. Just nice easy drinking beer

On tap. Pours a gold amber with light head. Aromas of bread crusts, grain and plastic. Flavor of crisp grains, corn sugar, noble hops and bread crusts. Great for a pils. But let¬ís put that in perspective...
Golden pour, foamy white head. Nose is biscuit and floral hops. Taste is cracker, well water, floral and bitter hops. Spritzy mouthfeel with crisp finish with libgering bitterness.

Draft at Bru Craft. Slightly hazy bright yellow gold pour with egg white foam. Good wave crests of lace. German yeast in the aroma. Moderately sharp lemony citrus notes balanced well with light toasted bready malts. Grassy and floral. Lemon poppyseed pound cake. Celery hearts. Dandelions. Bread dough. Apricot fuzz. Clementines. Coriander. Sage. Thyme. Sea salt. Green peppercorns. A pleasantly complex pils.
On tap at the Blue Dog in Chalfont. Cloudy yellow with a small sized head. Citrus, spices, grassy, and floral.

Pours hazy blonde with a white frothy head. Typical noble hops signature featuring herbal spicyness and cracking malts. Light bodied, highly quaffable, great bitterness. Spot on pils. I wanna drink that everyday of my life. Wow. A Pils can be that good. Fantastic stuff.

2 oz sample. Amazing pilsner, especially considering that I¬ím not the biggest fan of the style. The malt is showcased really well, and it is bready and toasty with that distinct pilsner malt aroma. Hops are present but not overwhelming. So good I thought about getting a growler of it (but everything else was too awesome to pass up).

Sampler at The Reservoir. Hazy light golden with a thin white head. Noble hops, grainy malt, peppery, grassy, a little sulphur. Pils smoothness, relaxed carbonation. Basically dry with reasonable bitterness. Nice stuff.

Mostly hazed metallic gold, consistent head retention. Aroma complete with lemon oil, both fresh grass and hay, baguette with a touch of salinity, cracked pepper, soft, subtle herbs. Charming touches of dried apricot and pear detail a different hop approach, possibly. Similar flavor; brisk mineral snap followed by mild peppery spice, fresh dough, lemon acidity and a ringing floral honey sweetness. Clean palate, classic soft carbonation and earthy, drying finish. This isn¬ít stunning but definitely hits every mark of a top flight pilsener.  Satisfyingly traditional while authentically original; more lagers please.

Glass on tap at the premise. Aroma: loads of wheat, herbacy notes. App: cloudy pale with greenish tint, small white head with good lacing and good retention. Taste and palate: medium body, crispy, loads of cereals in mouth, light medium long bitter / astringent finish. Overall: Not my favourite style but wanted to try it. Unfortunately, this isn¬ít up to HF standard. Good crisp mouthfeel but the bitterness isn¬ít that pleasant and even makes it hard to drink. Maybe I should have taken a taster.

Tap, at the brewery. Bright, clear straw colour. Dense, white head. Nose has grainy and creamy pilsener malts. Lightly spicy, grassy hop. Notes of citric rind. Taste is soft dry and bitter. Smooth mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Lightly bitter finish, with a dry close.

On tap at brewery. Pours hazy pale gold color with white head. Aroma is grassy malt, biscuit yeast, and tropical fruit. Flavor is a light sweet malt with spicy, earthy pilsner yeast and tropical fruit. Great Pilsner.

Growler @ tasting, courtesy of kermis. Pours a clear golden beer with a thick white head on top. Aroma is slightly hoppy, very grainy, bready and grassy. Flavor is bitter and hoppy, nice and crisp and full bodied. Great example of a pilsener, just the way it should be. Amazingly crisp, great balance and a great bitter aftertaste. Good carbonation just very nice. Top spot well deserved.

750 mL growler. Originally reviewed 2/11/2013,

Slight haze to it. Mostly clear yellow. Not much head on a vigorous pour. Thin collar after a bit.

Smells like a pilsner. Slightly hoppy. Earthy hop. Grainy pale malt.

Taste is quite a bit hoppier. Earthy and a little grassy. Grainy malts. Follows the nose with much more intense hop flavor. Bitter throughout the back end.
 Medium carbonation. Grainy finish. Intensely bitter, at least it seems to me. Pleasantly dry.
It¬ís good for a pilsner. Something I could drink a lot of, but not earth shattering like other HF beers.

On tap at the new tasting/growler filling room. Pour is a clear pale golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of grassy hops and crisp cereals, subtle and clean. Taste is nicely (med+) bitter with some nice and crisp baguette and crackery malts. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderately high and mouthfeel a little oily. Crushable, if only all pilsners were like this one! Another showcase of Mr. Hill¬ís great craftsmanship!
Draft at Black Back Pub. Pours a mostly clear pale golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma is pilsner malts, touch of European hops. Flavor is crisp, light malts. Good for a Pilsner.

Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Thin white head. hazy pale golden pour. Very good

Growler shared. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma of grain, grassy notes, light orange notes, light malt and light fruits. Flavour is light to light moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Above light bodied with light carbonation.
Pale yellow pour with aroma of apple, grain, and grass. Apple, grain and grass flavor with some hop bite. Very nice beer.
Light gold pour, fair sized head. Fairly hop forward in both the Aroma and taste: grassy, green apple, bread, yeast. Lighter body. Perfect for those 22 degree (celcius) november days.

The Well, Brooklyn tap: pours light gold with a white head. Aroma is really grassy and bready almost yeasty. Taste has a hop profile that I usually see on way crappier beers so it developed a negative connotation with me. However here it is done very well. I could drink more of this.
Pours a hazy dark orange with a thick white lacing. The aroma is malt forward, with noble hops in the nose, some sawdust.

Tap / Tirador.
@ Monk¬ís Cafe, Philadelphia, PA, USA
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Cereal, citrusy, sweet / Cereal, citrico, dulce.

2015-09-23 En f√ªt √† la brasserie. Robe jaune coiff√©e d'une belle mousse blanche. Ar√¥mes poivr√© et herbac√©. En bouche, grains croquants accompagn√©s d'une note poivr√©e et herbac√©e et d'une pointe citronn√©e. Texture soyeuse en bouche. Finale piquante et s√®che qui rend cette bi√®re extr√™mement facile √† boire. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Cloudy light golden pour with a nice head. Biscuits, grass, apple. Crisp, clean and well balanced. Very nicely made.

On tap at Monks cafe. So yeah, Hill Farmstead makes some pretty awesome beers. They make a good pilsener too but they don¬ít make pilsners into the best beers ever. I can definitely appreciate the crap out of this beer becaus it is a great pilsener, just not that differentiated from the other greats. Pours a clear pale yellow, white head. Aromas of grains and light lemon zest. Slightly fruity. Taste is light sweetness but finishes clean. Very nice.
Easy drinking pils, some helles malt qualities. Great middle malt charracter and finishes with a solid noble hop bit, dry. Is the best hf beer no but we¬íll done
Growler. Clear pale yellow pour with a white head. Huge Pilsner bouquet. What can I say it¬ís a Pilsner. A damn fine Pilsner. Crisp and clean. Good body and mouthfeel.

750ml growler pours clear golden yellow with finger of head. Nose is crisp field grain, cornbread, light orange and apple, soft dough. Taste is super balanced, clean tight medium-low bitterness, light grain, corn, apple, grass. Finishes dry, soft, low bitterness with some white breadcrust, grainy spice, corn, dough. Refreshing and tasty.

On tap at Monk¬ís cafe, Philly. Pours deep golden with fluffy, white head. Aroma is of biscuit malt, grain and some hops. Body is medium and crisp. Grassy hops, grain and pale malt nicely balanced on the palate. Finish is long, bready. Very good Summer brew.
Draft at churchville. Light golden pour with white head. Light crisp Pilsner malt aromas. Flavors are light malt, light fruit tones, definitely a sessionable Pilsner.

Draught at Armsby Abbey, 8/16/15.Wonderfully bright golden beer is well-carbonated, clear and shows a large, well-retained white head.Delightfully hoppy nose shows strong herbal character, with light earthiness and a touch of baked sourdough. Delicious mineral character from the water and or yeast shows through on the finish and the well-attenuated malts give off just the right amount of honey and fresh baguette character. No alcohol nor flaw.A blend of light minerality, fresh baguette, fresh herbs and a moderate amount of grassy-like bitterness all provide quite a bit of flavor but remain in balance. Impressively clean, malty but not sweet and with a fantastically tight carbonation making for a bright crispness on the finish and high drinkability. Hops seem very fresh and are used liberally (maybe a touch too much so?). Could/would drink this all day, if only.

On tap at Monk¬í Cafe. Pours straw yellow with a two finger white head with fantastic lacing. Aroma is of freshly baked bread, pils malts, grassy hops, spicy & earthy hops, pine, lime, honeyed sweet malts, biscuit malts, and some light fruityness. Taste is similar to the aroma. Has a medium body with a creamy, soft mouthfeel and a dry, moderately bitter, long, lingering finish. Overall, a very tasty, refreshing, and crusable pils that is my new favorite for the style by a long shot.
On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY. Clear golden yellow pour, crisp and easy to drink. A little bit of straw/grass feel to it. Hill Farmstead beers are always nice.

Mary est une Pilsener et appartient √† un style qui d¬íentr√©e de jeu n¬íest pas le mien. Toutefois, Hill Farmstead est totalement mon style. La combinaison des deux le fait absolument. D√©gust√©e en f√ªt le jour de l¬íouverture du tap room de la brasserie, cette bi√®re a un look de feu sous ce chaud soleil d¬í√©t√©! Le liquide est non filtr√© (comme toutes les bi√®res de cette merveilleuse brasserie) et couronn√©e d¬íune mousse absolument riche et collante au verre, ce qui est remarquable pour une bi√®re de ce type! En plus de brasser √† tout coup des bi√®res au look irr√©prochable, Shaun nous offre √† chaque fois une exp√©rience sensorielle unique! La texture de la bi√®re est parfaite: c¬íest rond, granuleux √† souhait, houblonn√© et ce, tant au nez qu¬íen bouche et ponctu√© par cette levure Pils qui habituellement ne me convient pas mais l√†... Je passe du grain √† un houblonnage que je n¬íavais jamais vu dans une Pilsener. Il est facile de saturer une bi√®re de houblons mais ici ces houblons sont √† la fois percutants, pertinents et doux. Une expression me vient en t√™te lorsque je pense √† cette bi√®re: une main de fer dans un gant de velours.

Aroma barnyard, 
Appearance pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate medium body, soft carbonation, 
Overall a nice lightly bitter beer that I would suggest to a friend

Draft at farmhouse Burlington. Clear yellow gold. Aroma of honey and Pilsner malts. Extremely smooth body and finish. Top notch German Pilsner. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Prohibition Pig. Pours light amber with a foamy white head that lingers. Copious lacing. Nose is a touch skunky in the Pilsner norm. Taste is slightly bitter. Dry finish. Good for a pils.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy gold pour. Aroma grassy hops. Tastes hops that clash with grain background- out of style. Not as good as ales from hill. Pilsners are not their specialty- there is no way this is the best pils in the world.

Glass, 16-ounce, draught, during Dark Lord Day (with Luc Bourbonni√®re), savoured on April 24 2015; eye: straw, hazy, thin sheet of beige head, nice lacing; nose: floral hops, slight malt, "pils", sulfur; mouth: floral hops, slight malt, "pils", semi-dry finale in floral hops with light presence of soap gum, medium body, good carbonation, mildly bitter, slick texture; overall: quite good
 
FRAN√áAIS
 
Verre, 16 onces, en f√ªt, durant Dark Lord Day (avec Luc Bourbonni√®re), savour√©e le 24 avril 2015; ¬úil : paille, voil√©e, mince couverture de mousse beige, bonne dentelle; nez : houblon floral, tr√®s l√©ger malt, ¬´ pils ¬ª, soufre; bouche : houblon floral, tr√®s l√©ger malt, ¬´ pils ¬ª, finale semi-s√®che en houblon floral avec l√©g√®re pr√©sence de gomme savon, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, moyennement am√®re, texture coulante; en r√©sum√© : bien bon

Draft at craft ale house. Pours clear straw yellow with a large white head that has excellent retention. The aroma is exactly classic with grass, straw, a touch of biscuit, quite floral. The taste is light, crisp, a touch of melon, and a light bitterness. Very good Pilsner.
Draft at CAH, Pours clear pale yellow. Aroma is pilsner malt, vegetal qualities, cereal and mild lime. Taste is similar with a nice clean finish. Very nice pils.

Good grief this is off the hook. Not usually a pils fan, but this one is so light, so crsip, and so clean, there¬ís nothing to dislike here. Just an incredible take on the style, with a nice clean hop presence that makes you want to come back for a bit more juiciness and dry finishing. Yep, these guys know how to make beer. Honestly, if you¬íre a pilsner fan, this is what every single beer in the style should try to measure up to. Nothing is close.
On tap at Bainbridge. Hazy gold with lacy spots. Nose is orange peel, grain and honey. Medium light with a soft buzz. Taste is melon, citrus peel and pith. Nice hoppy pils.

Pours thick unclear golden juicy orange with a huge creamy lacy white head. Aroma and flavor of sweet and juicy orange hops balanced on a full thirst quenching body. It is more like a delicious single IPA with a balanced hoppy ending, absolutely love this beer on tap. Take a pilsner and make it Vermont influenced hoppily perfect.

On tap at Armsby Abbey: pours clear golden with a white foamy head. Aroma of German malts and typical pils hops. Taste is all of the best qualities of a pilsner slammed into your facehole. Nice clean malts, mildly sweet, with a tiny bite on the back to finish it off. Light body, tons of flavor, best pils I¬íve ever had.
Golden color with a small, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of toast, straw, toffee, grains, grass. Taste of toast, grass, sweeter grains, mineral dry finish.
Draft at the rye house NYC. Pours a light crisp yellow tan color. Very easy session beer with a Nice balance

Clearish golden with a nice white head. Light grassy hops, some slight perfumey, spicy noble hop. Flavours are honey, bread dough, nice grassy hops, lightly herbal. Very nice example of a style i tend to avoid these days.
Growler. Pours cloudy yellow white head. Nose/taste of lemon, peppercorn and light citrus bread - lighter medium body.

Tap. Pours clear golden, small creamy white head, nice lacing. Aroma is light cereal, grass, biscuit. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, grassy, bready malty, notes of cereal grain. Lingering bitterness. Medium body, soft creamy mouthfeel. Shawn knows his beer, I am just not huge on the style.

Sampled while in line at the brewery. I struggled with this - as Matt said it nailed the style, but I really do not enjoy Pilsner. - I think its the combination of the malt profile and the specific hop varieties but who knows..maybe on a really hot day sitting on the beach...but even then give me a crappy pale ale instead.
Taster at the source pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Aromas of honey dough grass and malt. Taste is nice and follows aroma biscuit grass and balanced hops.

Tap: Cloudy, hazy golden-amber body with a thick & creamy layer of eggshell colored foam resting on top. Huge doughy aroma with tons of pilsner malts, grass, earthy Noble hop bitterness, faint must, some timid lemon zest, baked bread, & a sizable amount of soft, lightly sweet cereal grains. Flavor follows the nose exactly. Loads of baked graininess, sweetbread, & grassy, lightly bitter Noble hops that tingle with a modest earthy spice towards the finish. Underlying DMS in the finish with a hint of sulfur, pale malt, straw, & a chunky bit of clean layer yeast. Loads of baked bread coats the mouth in the finish. Really nice take on a German lager.

En f√ªt. Couleur dor√©e translucide, mousse blanche laissant une belle dentelle. Ar√¥me de c√©r√©ales, malt, houblon herbal, levure. Go√ªt de c√©r√©ales, houblon herbal. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

Growler 750ml.
Pours slightly hazy blond with medium white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of grain, pilsner malt, flowers. Taste is of grain, bitterness, fruits, spices, flowers. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Quite nice. Pilsy. Nice grain, clean. Well balanced.

Had on guest tap at DLD 2015. Absolutely loved this beer. Beautiful medley of the malts and hops, and bar none the greatest pils I¬íve ever laid lips upon. This beer alone was worth the price of admission to DLD.

golden pils with a thin creamy lacing white head. In aroma, classic smooth biscuit malt with grassy German hops, light mineral notes, nice and smooth. In mouth, a nice biscuit malt with grassy German hops, citrus pulp, very nice and smooth, light mineral notes, classic pils. On tap at Dark Lord Day 2015.

Don¬ít waste your time and money flying to Europe in search of the perfect pilsener. It¬ís made right here in the USA.   
Tap at Hill Farmstead. Pours semi clear with a slight haze. Aromas of delicate florals and light honey. Extremely clean, probably the cleanest beer I¬íve ever tasted. Very mineral like quality with some lightly baked bread. Aromatic and quenching. Dry. Light lingering bitterness. Expressive. 
Best example of a pils on the planet.

2 l growler filled last Saturday, shared. Pale hazy gold pour with rich lacy white head. Aroma is really nice, light grassy hop, very floral, soft honey malt notes, doughy, bready malt, really nice malty aromas. Taste is hoppier than the nose, nice grassy bitterness but again the malt comes out beautifully, reallly smooth balanced bready honey flavors, fresh grain, very nice. Palate is silky, nice body, good dry finish with just enough carbonation to keep things lively. Really tasty, and not too americanized.
Pours light pale gold / yellow, thin white head. Aroma is pale malt, grains, hay, light fresh hop. Flavor is much of the same, super clean & fresh.. A beauty of a Pilsner.

Taster at the source. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is white bread, yeast, banana, citrus, floral. Soft and smooth with white bread, citrus, some grassy bitter. I¬ím not a huge fan of the style, but this is very well done.

Fraichement coul√©e de la source, c¬íest une des plus formidable bi√®re de soif. Hyper florale et herbac√©e pour accompagner une pr√©sence zest√©e ass√©chante. Utiliser les houblons allemands de cette fa√ßon fonctionne avec moi et c¬íest une des rares bi√®res que je voudrais en permanence au frigo.

Growler thanks to Leighton. Pours a hazy yellow with a small frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong wheat, citrus, grain, hay. Thick mouthfeel with nice citrus, wheat, grain, with nice crispness, easy to drink, very good.
Crystal clear golden. Lemon and floral aroma just so so nce. Almost Kolsche like. Great carbonation, flavor is so crisp and well balanced. A++++

On tap at the brewery on 21. June 2014. Standing two hours in line. Big thank you to Russel for his patience and driving. Light unclear golden in the glass. Starts definitely as a smooth grainy Pilsener, but in the second row, the typical Hill Farmstead floral hop taste reaches the stage. Highly recommended. Wish a I had taken a box of it in my case back home ...

750 growler consumed 2 days after its purchase. Clear yellow-gold with impressive white head. Very perfumy and aromatic: huge passionfruit, white fruit and cereal. Taste nicely showcases honey malt, some cereal and substantial hop bitterness. Palate is rather rich for the style. Not so close from the german pils I¬íve tried during my trip, still better than most. A very good american interpretation of the style.

UPDATED: AUG 25, 2015 Draft at black pack with vin and Keith. Pours a bright hazy yellow with thin white lacing. Aroma is super crisp clean pale malt, light skunk and light grassy tones. Mouthfeel is thin and crisp - super dry and sessionable. I wish this pilsner could replace all the commonplace bullshit pilsners in nyc.

750ml growler. Blonde with a thin foamy white head. Slight haze. Flavors are crisp malts, bread, honey, lemon, pear and grass with spicy and floral notes. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, creamy texture.

This beer made me rethink pilsners...so wonderful. Clear pale pour. Aroma was outstanding floral, herbal, and lemon. The taste had the pils base, but danced with pepper, lemon, and floral notes. Light and airy. Intensely wonderful.
Light yellow, whisp of head. Smell and taste of pepper, herbs with a white grape finish

My Bottom Line:
This airy lager sprays peppery and herbal hops onto crisp cereals, leading to a balancing bitterness and much smiling.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A dollop of foam sits atop the misty blond.
-The ingredients may well be German, but the mouthfeel is definitely Hill Farmstead.
-The aroma is very enticing.
-Malts also share a bite of doughy bread.
-Hops also have citrusy angles.

Growler.

From a growler. Pour is a clear pale yellow with a tight white head and foamy lacing left behind. Nose is light grain note, a bit of peppery yeast and notes of lemon and grassy herbal hops. Taste has more grain bill, less peppery but still a hint of it. Hop presence is stronger, grassy and herbal with a moderate amount of sweetness and lemon but well attenuated. Medium to light body, slightly syrupy with a decent bit of carbonation and a very dry finish.

Growler de 2L. Merci beaucoup √† David! Ar√¥mes assez intenses de houblons floraux et poivr√©s. Touche citronn√©e. Robe blonde et l√©g√®rement voil√©e, effervescence tr√®s voluptueuse et belle mousse blanche. En bouche, les c√©r√©ales sont bien exprim√©es et contribuent √† une texture en bouche ph√©nom√©nale, souple et a√©rienne. L¬íhoublonnage est √©galement √† l¬íavant-plan, avec des notes florales et l√©g√®rement citronn√©es. Finale s√®che et d√©licatement am√®re. Pas totalement authentique, mais incroyablement savoureuse et facile √† boire.

Growler bought 4 days ago. Very pale veiled yellow pour covered with a vigorous, stable white head. It¬ís all there in the nose, the inviting sulphury, stoney, minty, egg shell notes which remain subtle and clean, the surprisingly aromatic hops showcasing citrus fruits and tree fruits alike (lemon, lime, grapefruit, but also pear and maybe even passion fruit) - yet these are not myrcene laden American varietals and in mouth, this starts making more sense as a green grassiness, a general herbaceous and spicy side kick in and takes a lot of room, culminating into a clean, yet firm bitterness, perhaps accentuating (or accentuated by?) the general dryness. This dryness is interesting though, as the beer, while feeling quaffable thanks in large part to the elegant crispiness, is pretty malty indeed. In spite of feeling dry on the tongue, it feels round, not filling, but certainly cerealic, bready and gently chewy rather than chubby - all this in spite of the fairly active carbonation, especially for a growler. Cool stuff, I had high expectations and this did not disappoint. While a bit stronger than your average pils, it manages to compensate its extra maltiness by well-integrated fragrant hops, and a refined texture.

Clear light yellow color, frothy white head. Floral, grassy, bread malt, some hay, lemon peel, and spice. Reminiscent of a witbier almost. Delicate sweetness initially with light hop bitterness in the finish. Light in body, moderately carbed, and fairly crisp.

Cloudy pale yellow, light white head. Floral head, some grassiness. Bitterness, crisp tang. Not much in the way of malt. Light body, highly effervescent. Very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler... Lightly hazed yellow lager with a small, wispy, white head. Good retention. The bouquet  presents both bready notes and multi-colored peppercorns. Light-bodied with airy carbonation. The flavor is heavily bitter, especially for the style. Finishes crisp, bitter, raspy and dry. Leaves me with a lemon rind aftertaste. Muchos kudos to ctipping for sharing this one with the south Florida crew!
Light yellow pour with white head and lace. Flat paper, light malt, and earthy hops. Light malt with a resiny bitter. Thin and watery but very good.

In short: An exemplary hoppy blond lager, german pilsner for the American palate.
How: Tap at Blackback Pub, Waterbury VT. (later a few growlers home).
The look: Cloudy yellow-blond body topped by a medium white head that quickly recedes to a persistent small layer of foam leaving lots of lacings on the glass.
In long: Nose is fresh cereals, noble-ish hops that emanates dry yellowed grass, lemons and even some grapefruits.  Not the usual aromatic bomb that are Hill Farmstead draught beers, this is nonetheless an very inviting aroma with an overall great freshness sensation.  Taste has the signature Hill Farmstead malt/water/mouthfeel signature similar to most of their single hop IPAs, fresh cereals (bakery bread and crackers), chewy but not doughy, low sweetness, plenty of very soft bubbles creating a voluptuous super-comfortable monthfeel.  Also a light boiled egg-white sensation which is something I somehow often get from lager yeast.  A generous hopping that is very soft on the palate, some lemongrass, sundried yellowed grass, bitter grapefruits, lemon juice.  Since Mary is a pils by the hops-obsessed Hill Farmstead I expected a denaturized hop-bomb of a pilsner, not the case here, although certainly americanized over-hopped by german pils standards I find that a fresh Prima Pils has a more assertive hop bitterness than Mary.  A superb session beer that I would like to see become a regular next to Edward in HF lineup. I ordered my beer by telling the waitress at Blackback ¬ìplease MARY me!¬î and I laughed and laughed and it truly scares me how often I¬íd punch myself in the face if I wasn¬ít me.

Une autre d√©gustation dans la ligne d¬íattente. Je dois dire que les gens qui y travaillent sont fort courtois et sympathiques ce qui rend l¬íattente moins p√©nible et que dire de la bi√®re. Cette Mary se pr√©sente sous un liquide dor√©e jaune avec une  mousse blanche. Le nez est classique avec des grains continentaux, des houblons nobles et ce qui semble √™tre des notes de levure weizen, de la banane. La bouche est trop facile √† boire, des grains, c√©r√©ales, houblons de tout acabit.

Growler shared by Drew. Awesome. Pours a slightly hazed gold with a stiff white head. Nose is spicy and herbal, distinctly noble character. Some sweet pils malt in the nose as well. Super clean. At first, seems a touch too much hop flavor but the bitterness grows to support it. Drying finish, not astringent. Super clean and balanced. Great malt flavor for just 2-row. Fuckin¬í a this is superb.

Growler thanks to briandot!! Just a fantastic pilsener. Slightly cloudy beautiful golden pour with the classic, full HF fluffy white head. Nose and flavor bring crisp, clean noble hop bite, bready dough and luscious yeasty balance. Balanced, effervescent, Outstanding.

750 ml growler from the HFS. Tall pils glass shows a lightly hazy straw color with ample carbonation. Sticky spider web lacing down the side.  Nose is light malt and grain. A mild hoppiness is upfront with a grassy, hay flavor and a moderate level of sweetness. Lemon and honey notes. Mild  lingering bitterness. Very light body and very refreshing. I got to say this is the best American pilsner I have ever sampled. The only other American pilsner I remember being this good was Cigar City Patio Pils. Well done Mr. Hill.

Growler @ Rachel¬ís place, shared by Steve_0. Thanks so much- I¬íve been wanting to try this one for a while! Pours a hazy, light yellow orange appearance with an off white head. Sweet fruity yeasty, lemon, light tropical fruity, sweet toasted malty, cracker, lightly herbal aroma. A bit more on the sweeter/fruity side than some Pilseners, but still very enticing. Very refreshing flavor that again is a bit more on the sweet side, but I think that makes it a great session beer during a hot summer day. Lemon, light fruit cocktail, a bit grassy, somewhat herbal, light mango, quite yeasty flavor with a bit of acidity on the finish. Soft carbonation. Not what I was expecting, but fuck it (butt fuck it?), it¬ís a damn nice beer and probably would be fun as fuck to beer bong (or use for beer pong). Can you imagine filling your solo cups with this during beer pong? Holy hell, that would be an experience. Thanks again, Stephen!
Growler, pours hazed yellow with foamy white head. Aroma hay, florals, grainy. Flavors florals, sweet corn and grain, bit peppery, clean and crisp, firm. Great pils.

750 mL, swing-top at home, courtesy of Frank. Thanks again man! Pour is slightly hazy straw-colored with a big fluffy white head and great lacing. Snappy, crackery, somewhat spicy aroma - with lighter notes of grass, lemon zest, straw and biscuit. Taste is much the same - biscuity, bready, grainy, almost chewy - grass, earthy/spicy hops, lemon peel, a touch of flowers, and honey with a lightly bitter finish. Full, yet airy mouthfeel with high carbonation. I am not a huge fan of Pilseners, but this one was super-easy drinking and tasted extremely fresh. It makes me want to go to Germany and experience what a real lager is like.

750mL growler, sent from Glougloburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a clear straw yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is full of grassy hops, straw, a little corn and biscuity malt. Flavour is uber-dry, with loads of puckeringly dry grassy hops, German lager yeast quite highly pronounced, and some citric notes. Extremely dry with quite a harsh astringency. Super-refreshing with high drinkability. Excellent stuff.

28th February 2013Growler courtesy of my Hill Farmstead pusher - Leighton! Cheers Ears! Light haze on this pale gold beer, little white head. Light palate, a little crisp. Mild minerals. No real lagerish malt but there are pleasant citric hops - mellow grapefruit and orange peel. Semi dry crispy finish. Very light and suppable.

En f√ªt sur place.  Un liquide jaune et sa merveilleuse t√™te blanche.  Une dentelle tiss√©e sur la paroi du verre.  Un nez de c√©r√©ales rustiques, de bl√© et de houblons nobles avec des parfums citronn√©s et des effluves qui peuvent ressembler √† la banane.  Des saveurs d√©licieuses de houblons en herbes, de c√©r√©ales campagnardes et de fleurs citronn√©es.  Une bouche l√©g√®re et bien a√©r√©e.  Une finale piquante comme le bl√© et mordante comme les houblons poivr√©s.  Ridiculement bonne.   Une bi√®re qui vaut amplement les 218 kilom√®tres qui me s√©parent de cette sensationnelle brasserie.

Growler thanks to Leighton. It pours clear yellow with a medium white head and a few suspended black particles. The nose is clean, delicate, floral, perfumed, orange and tangerine. The taste is crisp, pithy citrus, straw, light spice, nice bitterness, floral, biscuit and light dough with a bitter finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Smooth, easy drinking and well-balanced.

The beer is golden yellow and transparent with two inches of fluffy, white head that forms a whipped merengue dome atop the beer. Aromas of pils malt, lager yeast, floral hops, biscuits. True to style. Effortless to drink and enjoy. I'd love to have a keg of this for the warmer months.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared by Thorpe at Blue Lobster! Thanks. Pours a light straw color with a nice sudsy foam. Nice grainy aromas with traces of citrus and grassy noble hops. The palate is crisp and clean with nice balance between light malts, restrained hops and touches of earthy spice and citrus... would like a little more doughiness in the mouthfeel but otherwise its a spot on pilsner with a clean refreshing finish.

pours unclear but bright yellow with a small but persistent white head that laced my HF¬ís stemware, eheh. very fresh graininess, citrus and pepper, fruity lemon, noble hops - floral and citric. chewy and bready malts. average carbonation, light ot medium body - oily, yet quaffable, superb sharp floral and citric finish. would be my everyday summer beer or while cooking but...

Growler (750 ml) filled at the brewery yesterday. Unclear yellow with a small white head and heavy lacing. Aroma is crisp and clean with noble and grassy hops. Taste is also crisp with grassy notes, slight citrus, honey and cerales. Mouthfeel is crisp and slightly dry.  I could drink tons of this. Really refreshing and drinkable.
Classic Pilsner. Perhaps a bit more bitterness than the Reinheitsgebot would traditionally allow, but I like that just fine.  crisp, dry, simple, exceptional.
growler shared by Leighton .. . pours a deep gold, lightly hazed .. . mild crispness .. . hay and grain .. . full mouth feel .. . good beer, no surprise from hill farmstead .. . . marble, calm down!

4 oz sample glass while waiting in line for bottles @ Hill Farm. This was the first beer we tried at the brewery...glad HF is trying their hand at Pilseners. Pours glowing straw gold with awesome miniscule bubbled head, great lasting ability and lacing. Notes were very crisp and dry, spicy pilsener, earthy hops, light malt, and a light body. Not a huge pils fan since they all taste similiar and bland for the most part, but this HF version was definitely an exception to the rule. So easy to session on with a enough flavor to keep you coming back.

Growler @ Bruce¬ís. Cheers to Leighton for all the HF beers! The pour¬ís a slightly hazy gold color with a small head. There¬ís a few black floaties in the glass. The nose is a bit of toasted white bread, graham cracker. Notes of honeyed pear, golden syrup, breakfast cereal. The taste is glazed doughnut, a bit of honeyed toast. Nice hoppy tangerine sweetness on the finish. Nice crispy carbonation on the palate. Smooth and effortless on the palate. Overall, a really nice beer. I could easily polish off a gallon of this.

Growler shared by Leighton at RBWG.  Pours a fairly translucent golden straw with a steady sudsy white head.  Nose of doughy/bready malts, some grassy noble-like hops, minerals, light florals.  Flavor is similar, tastes very fresh, more bready malt, grassy/floral hops.  Nicely done but far from my favorite HF.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2013 Growler at Bruce¬ís. pours lightly hazy gold with a fine, creamy white head. Delicate, dry biscuity notes in the nose, some floral hops, dry straw. Light sweet flavor with toasted grass bitterness, straw, dry biscuity pale malts. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Crisp, clean finish, sturdy bitterness, dry lemon peel, grass, straw. Exceedingly crisp and very drinkable. (4.0)A growler somewhere along the line. Pours clearish yellow, fairly effervescent, with a fine, white cream head. Fine, biscuity and doughy malt nose. Light sweet flavor with sturdy, bitter straw, light grass, faint tangy lemon. Light bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Good bitter straw finish, light dirt, some citrus and lemon rind, hay, biscuity malts. Quite nice. (4.1)

Growler shared at the RBWG welcome dinner 
Appearance: Clear straw yellow with a small white head and light lacing 
Aroma: Honey and dusty 
Taste: Dusty malts and citrus 
Light but easy drinking

750mL flip-top thanks to Leighton at RBWG. Pours a low haze straw. Medium white foam. Webbier lace. Nose is meyer lemon, fresh melon, honeydew, sweet cider, fresh apple. Taste is meyer lemon, honeydew. Palate is ultra soft, bitter, rindy honeydew melon. Finish has hints of paper. Didn¬ít get a lot of snappy/crackery malt.
2/21/13. Growler at RBWG. Nice head and lacing. Rich hoppiness and nice malt backing on the aroma and flavor. Tasty!

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2013 Thanks Leighton. Growler at Ratebeer Winter Gathering. Great lacing and head. Aroma of hops with a bit of honey. Very smooth, earthy and a bit gritty. Pretty damn good. This is the best pilsner that I have ever had.

Swing top to taster at RBWG (thanks Leighton). Looks good for the style; a fairly transparent gold with white lacing. Smells and tastes solid; doughy with a nice hop presence and great balance. Good on the palate with a nice, snappy finish. Probably the best pilsener I¬íve ever had.

Pour from a 750 ml. growler gave a lightly golden hued beer with some snow white head. Aromas of grass and slight citrus. Light in body as would expect and fresh clean flavors. Nicely dry with some hoppy bitter qualities in the middle and finish. Great Pilsner.

750 flip top growler shared by Paul... Thanks! Pours a slightly hazy light yellow. Smells of lemon, grass, and yeast. Taste is a crisp, clean lemon flavor with a dry finish. Seems like he should have filled green flip tops for this one.
Pours yellowish green with a thin single line head around the glass.  The nose is almost that of a saison.  Notes of fresh cut grass.  The finish could be drier.

6oz pour at the brewery.  Pours a hazy, straw yellow with some lacing white head.  Nose of honey, straw, noble hops, grassy.  Flavor is spot on, lightly sweet, crisp, malt, grass, straw, lemon.  Dry finish.  Really solid.

Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow with a huge foamy white head...very nice lacing and retention.  Aroma has a touch of malty sweetness with some pleasant light lemongrass notes.  Flavor has a touch of lemongrass and significant bitterness...spicy and grassy...crisp and firm...touch of soapiness.  Mouthfeel is medium and creamy with a spicy/bitter dry finish.

Growler from the Brewery. Straw color with a slightly hazy body and magnanimous white frothy head that stands tall throughout. Grapefruit and lemon juice in the nose with hints of spicy hop character. Beautiful clean crispness in the flavor. Bready malt with lemon rind and assertive spicy bitterness. Light body with caressing effervescence and a super dry and fresh with a clean finish. I would drink this all day...

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2013 tap at the source and growler, my brothers.   aroma of dry bitter crisp rustic wet grass,  foggy dank farm air, clean bright cracker malts.  a hint of abrasive grassy bitterness takes away from the sessionable nature of this beer, but truly wonderful otherwise.   dry, complex.  a little too good.

Shrink-wrapped 750mL swing-top growler generously shared by yourefragile. Served in a Hill Farmstead long-stemmed tulip.

Pours a nice light straw-yellow color with a fluffy white head and good retention. Really nice lacing on the sides of the glass as it goes down.

The nose carries a good dose of grain and barley with some light floral and perfume notes. Really well-integrated. Light but fairly complex. Really impressive and on par with the best American pilsners I¬íve had, which mainly consist of those coming very fresh from Victory on tap.

Flavor starts with a nice grain character. Very smooth and soft. Comes in underneath floral-driven hops. Light earthiness and just a touch of spice. Light body and incredibly crisp. Ridiculously easy to drink. I could have easily taken down the growler and more by myself.
Sampled at the brewery.  Pours cloudy pale golden.  Aroma of pale malts and bread with a lot of floral hops.  Flavor the same.  Average texture.  A good beer for the style.

Had to stop by blackback to try this. No drinking for a month but tickers gotta tick. Got a sample. Enjoyed in an HFS glass. Ultra bright cloudy and unfiltered yellow. Hazy and really nice looking. 2 finger whip cream like head that fades slowly. Nose is a little spicy, zesty and German. That easy to recognize German yeast. Taste is good. Dry finish, wheaty and crisp. Some zest ad spice at the finish. Very drinkable. No astringency or booze notes at all

To be clear, I don¬ít like this beer style. Not a fan at all. Still, it¬ís pretty good, solid and drinkable

On tap at Blackback pub.  Hill Farmstead¬ís first go at a pilsener and it is nothing short of great.  Aroma is spicy german hops and a crisp clean malitness.  Appearance is very slight cloudy pale straw with nice white foamy head that has great retention.  Flavor is so crisp and clean with light cracker type malts and crisp grassy spicy hops.  The only American Pils thats even close to this is Uprights.  Fantastic.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2013 HF¬ís first lagered beer. Very exciting. 

Pours a hazier than expected straw golden color with a large white frothy head. Grassy and hoppy aroma and flavor follows with a pleasantly hoppy interpretation of the style. A little fuller bodied than expected with a crisp, clean dry finish. Nice change of pace from Edward for a HF "session" beer.
First to rate this beer, straight from the source,  it¬ís the smoothest crispest beer I¬íve ever had. Rediculous, hands down the best lager flavor and smoothness ever, thanks Shaun
